events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their vehicle on the highway, requesting insurance claim initiation immediately.
The claim was reviewed and classified under the 'Auto Accident' category due to reported car collision details.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to coordinate all follow-up actions and communications with the claimant.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured prompt processing.
The claimant was asked to provide police reports, vehicle damage photos, and medical bills related to the collision.
All requested documents including accident photos, police report, and repair estimates were submitted by the customer.
The investigation team began reviewing the claim details, documents, and evidence related to the vehicle collision.
Investigators concluded their review, confirming the cause of the accident and verifying claimant’s submitted proof.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repair costs and medical expenses was made to the claimant following investigation.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and provided positive remarks on the claims process.
The insurance provider formally approved the claim in accordance with the agreed settlement terms and conditions.
Payment was issued to the claimant’s nominated bank account covering repair and medical cost reimbursement.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and claimant’s final approval.
All records and correspondence related to the vehicle accident claim were archived for future reference.
